subject: Russ Mitchell: Imus In The Morning, Noon And Night
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






April 
      10, 2007
 
Hi, everyone,
 
Harry spoke this morning 
      with Barbara Ciara, vice president of the 
      National Association of Black Journalists, about the Don Imus controversy. Imus has been 
      placed on suspension by CBS Radio and MSNBC for racist remarks he made on 
      his radio program last week.
 
Also today, we welcomed Lou 
      Dobbs of CNN to The Early Show. Lou will 
      appear regularly on our broadcast to give us his take on the world. Today 
      he touched on the Imus controversy and the immigration battle.
 
Hannah began an exclusive two-part interview with Anna Nicole Smith's sister today. Donna 
      Hogan had harsh words for Howard K. Stern and Anna Nicole Smith's mother, 
      in her first interview since Smith's death. We'll have the latest on the 
      Smith saga tomorrow.
 
We saw the latest appliances for your home, comedian Martin Short and actor Shia LaBeouf stopped by to talk about 
      their latest projects, and Christopher Kimball of America's 
      Test Kitchen showed us how 
      to make a tasty meal.
 
Tomorrow, we'll have more from Anna Nicole Smith's 
      sister and Gene Simmons from the rock group KISS will visit us. Here's a 
      secret: the biggest KISS fan on the planet is no other than Julie Chen! 
      It's true!
 
See you tomorrow.

Russ
